intro: Oreocharis tsaii, commonly known as the Yunnan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and erect. Oreocharis tsaii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
